title: On the Stability of Discrete Dynamical Systems in Metric Spaces
venue: University of Mila â€” Master Thesis
abstract: We study the stability properties of discrete dynamical systems defined on complete metric spaces. Using fixed-point theorems and Lyapunov-type functions, we establish new sufficient conditions for the asymptotic stability of equilibrium points. Our results generalize classical theorems by relaxing the smoothness requirements on the underlying maps.

title: A Note on Topological Conjugacy of Expanding Maps on the Circle
abstract: We present an elementary proof that any two expanding maps of the same degree on the unit circle are topologically conjugate. Our approach uses symbolic dynamics and coding theory, providing a constructive method for building the conjugacy map.

title: Integral Inequalities and Their Applications to Differential Equations
venue: Proceedings of the Algerian Mathematics Conference
abstract: We derive several new integral inequalities of Gronwall-Bellman type and demonstrate their utility in establishing existence and uniqueness results for certain classes of ordinary differential equations with discontinuous right-hand sides.
